subject: Critical Thinking
title: Appeal to Emotion: Heart Over Head
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Appeal to Emotion: Heart Over Head.

hook.text: A charity ad shows a starving child. It raises millions. A report with the same data raises nothing. Emotion won.

buildup.text: Appeal to emotion: substituting emotional reactions (fear, pity, anger, pride) for logical evidence.

discovery.text: Sub-types include appeal to fear (ad baculum), appeal to pity (ad misericordiam), and appeal to flattery.

twist.text: Emotion isn't always irrelevant. Ethics requires empathy.

climax.text: Demagogues master this: make people angry first, present your solution second. The emotion does the persuading.

punchline.text: Feeling it doesn't make it true. But it makes it convincing.

quiz.question: When does appeal to emotion become a fallacy?
options: When emotional reactions replace logical evidence as justification
